lines.text:
[in front of Jake, Abby's date for the evening]
Mrs. McClure! Now I need to put the meat on broil but your hair is on bake. Which should I do first?

[humiliated]
I think the *hair*, Molly.
False hair, false eyelashes, false bosoms. In my day women were flesh and blood, now they're 70% nylon and 30% foam rubber.
The only thing I've never gotten is why parents never run away.
Pretty, huh. Why shouldn't he date a young chick? Why take the bus when you can fly?
Can I sleep with you, Mommy?
Go! Get moving!
There's nothing wrong with that. I was just going to ask you the same thing.
You're a great help to me. What am I supposed to say to this man? "Hi, I'd like you to meet my sister, the girl with the golden arm and her hair in the oven."

[During a raucous party]
If this wasn't my house I'd go home!
Thou art cool!

[walking into bedroom]
Mommy!

[hugging Jason]
What is it, sweety?
I can't find the bathroom!

[seductively]
Want to help with my garden?
No, Cleo, I think it's real bad luck to go digging around in somebody else's garden.

[They're all gathered at a table in a Chinese restaurant]
Boy, am I glad you two got married!
You are?
Mm-hmm. Because with six, you get eggroll!

[approaches Jake getting out of his car]
Oh, Jake... Well, howdy, neighbor.

[caught by surprise]
Oh, Hi, Cleo...
Sorry I haven't been over lately. I've been in Mexico - getting a divorce.

[Cleo then notices Abby getting out of the car]
Oh, I'm sorry, I thought you were alone.
No, no, I'm not... Abby, this is Mrs. Ruskin. She's my... it's the neighbor - next door.

[to Cleo]
This is Abby, my wife.
Well, I just, uh, *happened* to be walking down the street...
It's a nice night for streetwalking, yeah...
She *is* your wife, isn't she?
So my room isn't good enough for you, huh?
Nothing about you is good enough for me. This house is so weird!
You know what's wrong with you?
What, "Mr." McClure?
You're spoiled rotten, Miss Iverson.
Wait a minute, wait a minute... You mean to tell me that she is part of this family? This has got to be a plot against the chickens of America!

[the dogs are barking at each other]
Mr. Iverson, you know what? Our dog hates your dog.
No, they're just talking when they bark like that. They'll get to like each other all right.

[Offering Abby his bikers' help in finding Jake]
Saddle up, friends, we shall give thou a hand. That is our bag - to help folks!

[to the desk sergeant at the police station]
Your Royal Fuzz, let our mother go!

[to the desk sergeant at the police station]
You ain't groovy!
